department.dept_long_name: Division of Engineering and Applied Sciences

course.title: Physical Mathematics II
course.description: Theory and techniques for finding exact and approximate analytical solutions of partial differential equations: eigenfunction expansions, Green functions, variational calculus, transform techniques, perturbation methods, characteristics, integral equations, selected nonlinear PDEs including pattern formation and solitons, introduction to numerical methods.
course.prerequisites: Applied Mathematics 105 or equivalent. Also useful: Applied Mathematics 104 or equivalent.
course.notes: Applied Mathematics 201 and Applied Mathematics 202 are independent of each other and may be taken at any order.
